## 📋 PR Title

`<ship|show|ask>-WI <work_item_name>-feature <functionality>`

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.
    - show: It is used to merge development branches with the continuous integration branch develop in easy or intermediate level tasks. Here a pull request is required with more stringent automatic CI validations, ensuring that the implementation is consistent and correct before integration.
    - ask: It is used in merging development branches with the continuous integration branch for tasks of high or intermediate complexity, as well as in any merge of develop with the main production branch. In these cases, CI validations must be completed successfully and a review by the work team is necessary, with a minimum of one review recommended and even two to ensure the quality of the code before final integration.



---

## 📝 Description

title: show - WI_Weather_forecast - feature_add_Seville_weather_widget
body:
## 📋 PR Title

`show-WI Weather forecast-feature add Seville weather widget`

**PR Type:**  

- show

---

## 📝 Description  

This PR integrates a real-time weather widget for Seville into the home page using WeatherWidget.io. The widget provides dynamic weather updates, including temperature, conditions, and an icon representing the current weather. 

**Key changes include**:
1. Adding the embeddable HTML and script code for the widget to the home page template.
2. Styling adjustments to ensure seamless integration with the existing page layout.

title: WI Weather forecast - feature add Seville weather widget
body:
### Summary

Add a weather widget for Seville in the home page.

### Detailed description

This issue focuses on integrating a weather widget for Seville into the home page of the application, with the following key objectives:

1. **Real-Time Weather Updates:**  
   - Display up-to-date weather information for Seville, including temperature, weather conditions, and an icon representing the current weather.  

2. **User-Friendly Design:**  
   - Ensure the widget is visually appealing and seamlessly integrates with the existing layout of the home page.  

3. **Ease of Integration:**  
   - Use an external service (WeatherWidget.io) to simplify implementation, requiring minimal configuration and no backend dependencies.  

### Implementation Steps
1. **Select and Configure Weather Widget:**  
   - Use **WeatherWidget.io** to generate an embeddable widget for Seville.  
   - Configure the widget with the "pure" theme to ensure it aligns with the application's design.

2. **Embed Widget in the Home Page:**  
   - Add the widget's script and HTML code to the home page template.  
   - Verify proper display and functionality on different screen sizes and devices.  
  

## Dependencies
- **WeatherWidget.io**: Provides the weather widget script and embeddable code.  

### Priority

Medium

### Dificulty

Easy

### Fusion change relevance

Show

title: [BUG] - WI UVL Editor - feature solve update dataset problem
body:
### Summary

When you want to update a dataset due to updating a uvl, the verification that the uvl is correct is not carried out, so you can upload one that is wrong

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go into a dataset information page.
2. Go to edit one of the UVL models.
3. Edit the uvl with incorrect data
4. Notice that no error appears

### Expected result

You should not be able to upload incorrect uvls

### Actual result

You can upload incorrect uvls

### Priority

Medium

Linux

title: WI Tag Cloud - feature add selenium tests
body:
### Summary

Add Selenium tests to validate the functionality of the Tag Cloud interface.

### Detailed description

This issue introduces two Selenium-based end-to-end tests to ensure the correct functionality and user interaction flow of the Tag Cloud feature. The tests simulate user interactions and validate key behaviors of the Tag Cloud interface:

    Test Search Feature
        Simulates a user navigating to the application homepage and clicking the "Explore more datasets" button.
        Validates that the search input becomes visible and can be used to search for a specific tag (e.g., entering "11").
        Confirms that the search functionality works as expected and triggers the appropriate action.

    Test Visualize Tag
        Simulates a user clicking on the "Explore more datasets" button and selecting a tag (e.g., "tag1") from the Tag Cloud.
        Validates that the visualization for the selected tag is displayed correctly.

### Priority

High

### Dificulty

Easy

### Fusion change relevance

Show

title: WI Bot integration - feature create new tests
body:
### Summary

Add unit tests for create_node_route to validate behavior for chat, bot, and feature creation under specific conditions.

### Detailed description

This issue adds four new unit tests to ensure that the create_node_route functionality behaves as expected under various scenarios related to chat, bot, and feature creation:

    Test Creating a Chat Node with No Children
    Verifies that the service successfully creates a chat node when there are no existing child nodes.

    Test Bot Creation Limit with Exact Threshold
    Ensures that the system allows the creation of a bot when the number of existing bots is exactly at the limit (e.g., 5 bots).

    Test Chat Creation Limit with Exact Threshold
    Verifies that a new chat can be created when the number of existing chats is exactly at the limit (e.g., 3 chats).

    Test Feature Creation Limit with Exact Threshold
    Ensures that the system allows the creation of a feature when the number of existing features is exactly at the limit (e.g., 3 features).

Each test mocks the repository behavior to simulate specific scenarios and verifies that:

    The expected service methods are called with the correct parameters.
    The system returns the expected result when conditions are met.

### Priority

High

### Dificulty

Medium

### Fusion change relevance

Show

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.


---

## 📝 Description  

Implemented the functionality to store and track last_update_id for Telegram bot updates. 
This ensures that the bot fetches only new updates after the previous ones have been processed. 
Also, improved the offset logic to handle consecutive updates without retrieving the same messages.
Wait for workflows to execute and pass.

title: ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities
body:
## 📋 PR Title

ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.

---

## 📝 Description  

Ensure that workflows skip processing ship PRs if one or more checks have failed. 
Updated the conditional logic to correctly evaluate `FAILURE_COUNT` using `-ge` operator. 
This avoids unnecessary retries or further processing for non-mergeable PRs.

title: ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities
body:
## 📋 PR Title

ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.

---

## 📝 Description  

- Fixed improper usage of GitHub Actions syntax (${github.event.pull_request.number} in bash scripts).
- Improved error handling for gh CLI and jq commands.
- Refactored merge logic to ensure reliable PR merge conditions.
- Added detailed logs and validation checks for failed workflows.
- Structured bash script for better readability and maintainability.

title: ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities
body:
## 📋 PR Title

ship-WI Bot integration-feature test all functionalities

**PR Type:**  


    - ship: It is used for routine changes in development branches. In these cases, it is not necessary to create a pull request, since the changes are applied directly to the integration branch. Minimal automatic CI validations can be configured to verify basic changes.


---

## 📝 Description  

This update modifies the auto-merge workflow to ensure that it waits for other workflows to execute and pass before proceeding with the merge. The workflow now includes a loop that checks the status of the checks associated with a pull request (PR). It ensures that all checks have passed or that there is exactly one failed check. If these conditions are met, it verifies whether the PR is mergeable and proceeds with the merge.

The critical aspect of this update is the addition of a waiting mechanism, where the workflow will repeatedly check the PR's status until the desired condition (either all checks passing or only one check failing) is met. This prevents the workflow from attempting to merge a PR before all relevant checks have finished, ensuring that only fully validated PRs are merged.

This is a necessary step to prevent merging incomplete or untested changes and ensure that the PR is in a stable state before merging. The workflow will pause and retry the status check every 30 seconds until the condition is fulfilled.

The application displays an error message related to environment configuration and crashes immediately after attempting to load the initial screen.

show - Wi fakenodo - feature tests
body:
This pull request includes significant updates to the testing framework for the `fakenodo` module by enhancing the locust tests, removing outdated Selenium tests, and updating unit tests to cover new API endpoints. The most important changes include the following:

### Locust Tests Enhancements:

* [`app/modules/fakenodo/tests/locustfile.py`](diffhunk://#diff-d7d9536fcb275c514388d692c2f2832fb6ca8747db05683ce754755c6f81032fL1-R39): Replaced `TaskSet` with `HttpUser` and added new tasks to simulate GET, POST, DELETE, and publish requests to various endpoints of the `fakenodo` API. This enhances the testing coverage and simulates more realistic user interactions.

### Selenium Tests Removal:

* [`app/modules/fakenodo/tests/test_selenium.py`](diffhunk://#diff-629f7a0a765ad26ae0e7fedf4047f75b91de3a5093f18689055c67d4877aa1baL1-L35): Removed the outdated Selenium test `test_fakenodo_index` which was no longer necessary. This simplifies the test suite and removes dependencies on Selenium.

### Unit Tests Updates:

* [`app/modules/fakenodo/tests/test_unit.py`](diffhunk://#diff-f80010354976b599e2423b71b0461e00351867ee589bafdab01a09a87888323bR3-R74): Updated the unit tests to include new tests for the `fakenodo` API endpoints. This includes tests for connection, creation, file deposition, deletion, publication, and retrieval of depositions. These tests ensure that the API endpoints are functioning correctly and return the expected responses.

title: show - WI Download all datasets - feature test all cases
body:
This pull request includes significant changes to the `app/modules/download/tests/locustfile.py` file, which refactor the test structure and add new test tasks. 

Refactoring and new test tasks:

* Replaced `TaskSet` with `HttpUser` and added a `wait_time` between tasks to simulate user behavior more realistically.
* Modified the `index` task to remove the response status code check and added three new tasks: `download_all`, `download_datasets_by_date`, and `download_datasets_by_email`.
* Removed the `DownloadBehavior` class and directly assigned tasks to the `DownloadUser` class.
* Removed unnecessary imports and replaced them with relevant ones for the new structure.

title: WI Dashboard-feature test functionality
body:
### Summary

Perform all types of tests for the Dashboard work item.

### Detailed description

The task involves performing a comprehensive set of tests for the Dashboard work item. This will include:

    **Unit Tests**: Writing and executing unit tests to ensure the individual components of the Dashboard function correctly in isolation. These tests will focus on verifying the business logic and ensuring that each function performs as expected under various conditions.

    **Locust Tests**: Conducting performance testing using Locust to simulate user load and measure how the Dashboard performs under different levels of traffic. The goal is to identify any bottlenecks and ensure the Dashboard can handle expected and unexpected user activity efficiently.

    **Selenium Tests**: Implementing automated browser tests using Selenium to verify the front-end behavior of the Dashboard. These tests will ensure that all user interactions, visual elements, and page flows work as expected across various browsers and devices, providing an optimal user experience.

By completing these tests, we will ensure that the Dashboard is both functionally robust and performs well under load, providing a high-quality user experience.

### Priority

Medium

### Dificulty

Medium

title: show - Wi download all datasets - feature download all dataset
body:
This pull request includes significant updates to the testing framework for the download module. The changes involve restructuring the Selenium tests and adding unit tests with mock objects to improve test coverage and reliability.

### Selenium Tests Update:

* Replaced the old `test_download_index` function with a new `TestDownloaddall` class that includes multiple test methods for different download scenarios, improving the organization and readability of the Selenium tests.

### Unit Tests Enhancement:

* Added new unit tests in `test_unit.py` to cover dataset download functionalities using mock objects. This includes tests for downloading datasets by date range and by email, which enhances the test coverage and ensures more reliable testing.
* Introduced fixtures for `DataSetService`, `mock_user`, `mock_datasets`, and `DownloadService` to streamline the setup of test dependencies and improve test isolation.

body:
### Summary

# **Testing Types for WI Bot Integration**

## 1. **Unit Tests**
- **Purpose**:  
  Validate individual functions or components of the bot to ensure they work as expected in isolation.

---

## 2. **Selenium Tests**
- **Purpose**:  
  Perform end-to-end testing to simulate user interactions on the platform where the bot is deployed.

---

## 3. **Locust Tests**
- **Purpose**:  
  Conduct performance and load testing to evaluate the bot's behavior under high workloads.


### Detailed description

The tests will evaluate how the WI Bot functions on both **Telegram** and **Discord** platforms. The goal is to ensure compliance with issue policies and assess the bot's behavior across different environments. Each test type will focus on specific aspects of the bot's functionality, interaction, and performance.

### Priority

High

### Dificulty

Difficult

### Fusion change relevance

Ask

title: [BUG] - WI Improve UI - feature redesign interface
body:
### Summary

The application was initially designed with a light mode. However, during development, a dark mode has been introduced. Some elements have mismatched styles, such as light text on light backgrounds or dark text on dark backgrounds, causing several views to be unreadable or inconsistent.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Navigate through the explore view.
2. Go into a dataset information page.
3. Go to View one of the UVL models.
4. Observe the readability and color inconsistencies in the views mentioned.

### Expected result

All UI elements should have consistent colors and be fully readable.

### Actual result

Some views have light text on light backgrounds or dark text on dark backgrounds.

### Priority

High

### Attachments

![Untitled](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/59d39aaa-14d0-4400-8508-253549e89b7c)


### Operating System

Linux

### Browser

Firefox, Chrome

### Application Version

2.1.0

### Other eenvironment details

_No response_

title: WI Bot integration - feature cross module functionality
body:
### Summary

Enable the bot to integrate and interact seamlessly with existing application modules, ensuring consistent functionality and real-time data exchange. 

### Detailed description

The task involves developing a new bot functionality that ensures proper integration with key modules of the application.  

#### Key Objectives:  
1. **User Authentication Integration:**  
   - Bot should verify users using the authentication module.  
   - Ensure it can handle login sessions and identify unauthorized access attempts.  

2. **Notifications Module Integration:**  
   - Bot must trigger specific notifications to users based on predefined triggers (e.g., failed login attempts, completed actions).  
   - Notifications should include email and in-app alerts.  

3. **Analytics Module Integration:**  
   - Bot must fetch and display analytics (e.g., user activity stats) upon user requests in a readable format.  
   - Allow users to filter or sort data based on predefined parameters.  

### Priority

High

### Dificulty

Difficult

### Fusion change relevance

title: show - WI Bot integration - feature merge trees

title: WI Bot integration - feature merge trees
body:
This task involves improving the functionalities for merging when Run or Stop a chat. Cleaning n-ary trees in the system. The methods will manage tree operations with efficiency and correctness, focusing on the following:  

1. **Merging N-ary Trees:**  
   Combine two n-ary trees based on node names, ensuring that overlapping nodes are merged recursively while preserving unique nodes.  

2. **Cleaning Stopped Chats:**  
   Traverse the tree to identify "CHATS" nodes and remove subnodes with a status "0".  

The goal is to optimize both functionalities for better performance and maintainability, especially in scenarios with large or unbalanced trees.  

### Tasks  

- Refactor and optimize the backend logic for the `merge_nary_trees` method to ensure:  
  - Proper handling of nodes unique to `t2`.  
  - Structural integrity during the merge process.  
- Improve the `remove_stopped_chats` method to efficiently traverse the tree and handle deletions:  
  - Ensure that deletions do not impact sibling or parent nodes.  
- Conduct thorough testing of both methods with diverse tree structures, including:  
  - Balanced and unbalanced trees.  
  - Cases with deeply nested nodes.  
- Document the updated logic and test cases for future reference.  

### Acceptance Criteria  

- The `merge_nary_trees` method merges trees accurately and preserves unique nodes.  
- The `remove_stopped_chats` method effectively identifies and removes nodes as required.  
- The performance of both methods is optimized for large-scale trees.  
- All test cases pass successfully, validating the robustness of the implementation.  

### Labels  

- backend  
- optimization

The view will consist of several buttons, and each time a button is pressed, a specific dashboard will appear. This setup will allow users to easily navigate between different dashboards, providing quick access to the specific data insights they need.

WI Bot integration - feature tree structure sync
body:
This task involves creating the frontend and backend functionalities to visualize the tree structure representing the bot. Additionally, the database will be populated with two tables:  

- **`treenodes`**: Represents the nodes of the tree.  
- **`treenode_bot`**: Stores the configuration of the bots that are running in the system.  

The bot configurations will be displayed in a new module, allowing for easy management and visibility of the system's settings.  

#### **Tasks**  
1. Develop the backend logic for managing and rendering the tree structure.  
2. Create the frontend interface for visualizing the tree and interacting with the bot data.  
3. Design and populate the database with two tables:  
   - `treenodes`  
   - `treenode_bot`  
4. Integrate the `treenode_bot` table to display bot configurations in the new module.  
5. Test the module to ensure proper functionality and accurate visualization.  

#### **Acceptance Criteria**  
- The tree structure is fully visualized in the frontend.  
- The backend successfully handles data retrieval and updates for both tables.  
- The new module accurately displays bot configurations stored in `treenode_bot`.  
- Database population and management are seamless and efficient.  

#### **Labels**  
- `frontend`  
- `backend`  
- `database`

title: WI Sign up validation - feature third party validator
body:
## Summary
Allow users to register by verifying their email address to ensure their account is linked to a valid and accessible email. This enhances security and reduces the risk of identity theft and unauthorized access.

## Detailed Description
This feature will introduce an email verification step during user registration, ensuring that only verified email accounts can log in. 

### Acceptance Criteria:
1. **Send verification email:**  
   - When a user registers, the system should automatically send a verification email to the provided email address.  

2. **Verification link:**  
   - The email should contain a verification link.  
   - When the user clicks the link, the system should mark the account as 'verified'.  

3. **Restrict login for unverified accounts:**  
   - Users who have not verified their email will not be able to log in with that account.  

### Benefits:
- Enhances account security by linking each account to a verified email.  
- Reduces risks of identity theft and unauthorized access.  
- Improves overall platform trustworthiness.

## Priority
High

## Difficulty
Easy

## Fusion change relevance
Ship

title: WI Improve UI - feature redesign interface
body:
## Summary
To improve user experience and modernize the interface, redesign the layout of the dataset listing page. The goal is to enhance the usability of key elements and make the overall appearance cleaner and more user-friendly, inspired by GitHub's interface.

## Detailed Description
This issue focuses on a layout redesign of the dataset listing page to achieve the following objectives:

### Key Objectives:
1. **Enhance Usability of the left toolbar:**  
   - Improve the design and functionality of the left toolbar for easier navigation and accessibility.  

2. **Modernize the topbar:**  
   - Redesign the topbar to make it visually appealing and consistent with modern design standards.  

3. **Improve overall appearance:**  
   - Revamp the dataset listing layout to provide a cleaner, more user-friendly experience.  
   - Take inspiration from GitHub's interface, ensuring the page looks professional and is intuitive for users.  

4. **Focus on User experience:**  
   - Prioritize ease of use and simplicity in design to ensure a positive experience for all users.  

## Priority
High

## Difficulty
Medium

## Fusion change relevance
Show

title: WI Improve UI - feature sorted listing of datasets
body:
## Summary
The dataset listing currently lacks sorting options, making data browsing less efficient. To improve user experience, implement sorting features that allow users to organize datasets based on different criteria.

## Detailed Description
This feature focuses on enhancing the dataset listing page by adding sorting options, improving usability and accessibility for users.

### Feature Requirements:
1. **Sorting Options:**  
   Add buttons or dropdown sorting options above the dataset listing with the following criteria:
   - **Title:** Sort datasets alphabetically by title.  
   - **Creation Date:** Sort datasets by the date they were created (newest to oldest).  
   - **Number of Files:** Sort datasets by the total number of files in each dataset (highest to lowest).  

2. **User-Friendly Interface:**  
   - Ensure the sorting options are easy to locate and use.  
   - Update the layout as necessary to accommodate the sorting functionality without cluttering the interface.  

## Priority
Medium

## Difficulty
Medium

## Fusion change relevance
Show

title: WI Download all datasets - feature dataset download
body:
### Summary

Implement **`Download all datasets`** functionality.

### Detailed description
Implement **`Download all dataset functionality`** in SerranitoHub to allow users to download all datasets in a compressed file from the interface. This must allow the user to download all or part of the dataset (by user, date, time, etc.).

#### Key Objectives:  
1. **Download Functionality Integration:**  
   - Implement a feature to download all or selected datasets in a compressed format (ZIP).
   - Ensure support for filters by user, date range, and time range.

2. **User Interface Enhancement:**  
   - Design an intuitive UI component to select datasets and apply filters.
   - Provide clear progress indicators and error messages during the download process.

3. **Error Handling and Notifications:**  
   - Include notifications for failed downloads or incomplete operations.

### Priority

High

### Difficulty

Hard

### Fusion change relevance

Show

title: WI New test cases -feautre upgrade testing
body:
## Summary
We have noticed that it is very important to improve our testing in UVL-Hub. To address this, we have planned this Work Item.

## Detailed Description
This issue is meant to include the following characteristics:

1. **Run Selenium Tests Without Popping Up Windows:**  
   - UVL-Hub must run Selenium tests in headless mode so they can be included in the testing workflow.  

2. **Improve Testing Coverage:**  
   - Increase the testing coverage to ensure higher quality and reliability of the software.  

3. **Simplify Test Execution:**  
   - Make running all tests easier for the team.  
   - This could involve:
     - Improving Rosemary.
     - Adding more scripts to run tests.
     - Configuring an extension to streamline testing execution.  
   - While commands are effective, they may not be ideal for everyone on the team. Simplifying test execution is essential.

4. **Open to Additional Improvements:**  
   - Any other improvements that enhance testing, even if not explicitly mentioned here, can be included in this issue.  
   - However, if the improvement is not obviously related to testing, a separate issue should be created.  

Happy coding!

## Priority
High

## Difficulty
Medium

## Fusion change relevance
Show
